content:
=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame
  SpriteSet
    floor > Immovable randomtiling=0.9 img=oryx/floor3 hidden=True
    goal  > Door color=GREEN img=oryx/doorclosed1
    key   > Immovable color=ORANGE img=oryx/key2
    sword > OrientedFlicker limit=5 singleton=True img=oryx/slash1
    movable >
      avatar  > ShootAvatar   stype=sword frameRate=8
        nokey   > img=oryx/swordman1
        withkey > color=ORANGE img=oryx/swordmankey1
      enemy >  
        monsterQuick > RandomNPC cooldown=2 cons=6 img=oryx/bat1
        monsterNormal > RandomNPC cooldown=4 cons=8 img=oryx/spider2
        monsterSlow > RandomNPC cooldown=8 cons=12 img=oryx/scorpion1
      wall > Immovable autotiling=true img=oryx/wall3
      	

  LevelMapping
    g > floor goal
    + > floor key        
    A > floor nokey
    1 > floor monsterQuick
    2 > floor monsterNormal
    3 > floor monsterSlow
    w > wall
    . > floor
    

  InteractionSet
    movable wall  > stepBack
    nokey goal    > stepBack
    goal withkey  > killSprite scoreChange=1
    enemy sword > killSprite scoreChange=2
    enemy enemy > stepBack
    avatar enemy > killSprite scoreChange=-1
    nokey key     > transformTo stype=withkey scoreChange=1 killSecond=True

  TerminationSet
    SpriteCounter stype=goal   win=True
    SpriteCounter stype=avatar win=False
This is vgdl rule in natural language:
This game has elements of puzzle-maze navigation combined with real‐time action. Here’s the breakdown:

Genre and Overall Feel:
• It’s a maze/puzzle game with action combat. You navigate a level with walls, floors, doors, keys, and roaming enemies.

Core Mechanics:
• Movement in a maze‐like layout with static walls that block you.
• The player controls an avatar that, by default, starts as a “nokey” state.
• Interaction with certain objects changes your state. For example, when “nokey” touches the key, you transform into “withkey.”
• There is also a sword – an oriented, flickering projectile that the avatar uses (the “ShootAvatar” type) to attack enemies.
• Enemies appear in various speeds (quick, normal, slow), moving randomly and potentially hindering your progress.
• Collisions are key: bumping into the door “goal” as a plain “nokey” makes you bounce back, but if you have the key (“withkey”) then colliding with the door removes it and gives you a score bonus.
• Combat matters: using your sword against enemies scores points, while a direct collision with an enemy (when not using your sword) results in a penalty.

Objectives and Win/Loss Conditions:
• Main Objective: Collect the key and then reach the door (the “goal”) to finish the level.
• You can’t open the door until you’ve picked up the key and transformed into the “withkey” state.
• Win Condition: When the door (goal) has been successfully activated (or removed by its interaction with a “withkey” sprite), the game is won.
• Loss Condition: If your avatar is eliminated (i.e. its SpriteCounter reaches zero, which can happen if you let an enemy get you), you lose.

Suggested Overall Strategy:
1. Explore the Maze: Begin by carefully navigating the maze-like level. Your first priority is to find and pick up the key.
2. Change Your State: Once you touch the key, you'll transform from “nokey” to “withkey.” This allows you to interact with the door and eventually win.
3. Use Your Sword Wisely: The avatar can shoot a short-lived sword to deal with enemies. Use it to eliminate or divert enemies so that you avoid taking penalties when bumped.
4. Stay Alert on Enemies: Enemies come in various speeds, so keep an eye on their movement. If possible, dispatch them with your sword to keep the path safe.
5. Navigate and Exit: After securing the key, make your way to the door. Since the door won’t let “nokey” in (it steps you back), ensure you have the key before attempting to exit.
6. Balance Risk and Reward: While eliminating enemies scores you points, avoid unnecessary contact with them, as touch collisions by your avatar cause negative point changes and potential loss.

In summary, plan your route, secure the key as soon as possible, use your sword for defense, and then head to the door to unlock victory. Play it safe, manage enemy encounters smartly, and use every tool available to finish the level without losing your avatar.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.

Action:5

I'm moving the avatar upward from (3,2) to (2,2) to head toward the door along our planned path, expecting to eventually reach the door at (1,4) with our key.

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
floor goal -> 'g'
floor key -> '+'
floor nokey -> 'A'
floor monsterQuick -> '1'
floor monsterNormal -> '2'
floor monsterSlow -> '3'
wall -> 'w'
floor -> '.'
goal -> '@'
key -> '#'
monsterNormal -> '$'
monsterQuick -> '%'
monsterSlow -> '&'
nokey -> '*'
withkey -> 'm'
